content: are just as stretchy as the decrease columns the left-leaning increase is formed by a yo in the first row and a ktbl or ptbl in the second which twists the stitch to the left the right-leaning increase is formed by a byo in the first row and a k or p in the second going through the front loop of a byo twists the stitch to the right the result should look the same as the corresponding m1 increase - check your work in the first repeat to make sure it looks correct gauge 8 stitches and 12 row = 1 inch / 2 5 cm in stockinette one repeat 12 stitches of the chevron pattern when left unstretched is 1 25 inches / 3 25 cm wide it also has a row gauge of 12 row = 1 inch / 2 5 cm when measured along the increase/decrease columns to account for the smaller gauge of the chevron pattern you might consider using a smaller needle for the single-colour sections especially the cuff i walk the line v1 0 - shuyi wu - 2 instructions charts are located at the end of the document as well as the written version of the chart there are two versions of each chart a dark mc version and a light mc version use whichever version works best for you cuff using a stretchy cast-on of your choice cast on 72 84 sts with mc join for working in the round and add a bor marker if desired the cuff is worked in 2x2 rib as follows 2x2 rib *k2 p2 * repeat from * to * until bor work in rib for a total of 16 rounds or until desired length i recommend going for 2-3 rounds more than you usually would since the tips of the chevron pattern eat into the cuff a little bit leg introduce cc start following the chart repeating the chart across the round note that row 1-2 are worked in cc and row 3-4 are worked in mc when switching colours i drop the old yarn so that it hangs down and then bring the new yarn from the right over to the left trapping the old strand this forms a twist on the inside of the sock and minimizes the jog in the pattern continue to work the 4-row repeat until you reach the desired leg length ending after row 2 i e after a cc stripe size l only on the final round stop when you have 3 sts remaining move bor here and transfer the 3 sts to the instep side heel flap the heel flap is worked using mc only turn so that ws is facing you work the heel flap over the next 35 41 heel sts the heel flap is worked flat in row the remaining 37 43 instep sts are put on hold adjust your needles/markers accordingly row 1 ws k1 p33 39 k1 turn row 2 rs
